title: People are living longer. Some people think that it causes big problems. Others, however, think the ageing population has many advantages for business, government and for society in general. Discuss both views & give your own opinion
content:
Due to the consecutive development of the standard of living, an average person’s lifespan is lengthened. However, it has led to the state of an ageing population which is considered either to cause issues for authorities or to benefit the society. In my opinion, I strongly agree that the disadvantages outweigh the advantages of having an ageing citizen and through this essay, I will analyse the reasons for this assertion.  

To begin with, a shortage in the young label force could be seen as one of the gravest drawbacks to a country owning an ageing community. The dramatic decrease in the number of young dwellers has resulted in a reduction in the total of newborn babies per year. Alongside that, the elderly tend to avoid giving birth to an infant because their body can not accommodate the conditions of bearing a foetus. Therefore, there will be fewer options for the recruitment agency. Following that, the deficiency of new workers will deteriorate the country’s economy. As industries require many employees with youthful strength and commitment to serve the needs of humanity. For instance, the service industry demands an immense volume of workers to operate.

Besides, the ageing population also pressurises the economy with a tremendous amount of retirement pensions. As mentioned above, there are not enough staff which means that there will be no profits for the country’s income. The potential of a country is evaluated through their workforce and economic sustainability. Not only in a shortage of money and being unable to pay for the social welfare but the nation also can not call for foreign investments. Therefore, the opportunities for country innovation in every area will decline without the help of other nations.

In a nutshell, I believe that the drawbacks of an ageing population surpass the advantages of the effect of the old-aged workforce and the burden on the country’s economy.

title: In many part of the world, children are given more freedom than in the past. Is this a positive or negative development?
content:
Nowadays, in many societies, the youth have access to more freedom compared to the past. Whilst there are some drawbacks associated with this availability, I believe the main benefits are more substantial.

On one hand, the primary advantage of having more freedom is that giving permission utilizing up-to-the-minute gadgets leads to the privilege of having access to higher education sources and reinforcing their knowledge. In addition, having access to technology not only provides teenagers with a wide range of information to enhance their knowledge but also plays an important role in order to find their passion for a specific subject which can be their future job. For example, some channels on YouTube can be highly beneficial for children to learn more about a particular subject which used to be unavailable. A further benefit of freedom is that the youngsters have the opportunity to express their opinions which brings about a greater development in their personalities and more self-confidence as well. For instance, children who have been asked about their ideas feel more invaluable and have a chance to accelerate their maturity process.

On the other hand, giving freedom excessively can give rise to facing major problems. One disadvantage of freedom is that youngsters are more likely to be threatened by consuming cigarettes or other harmful drugs. Therefore, parents should allocate their children and raise their awareness about the detrimental effects of these behaviours. Another negative point of giving freedom is that teenagers can be prone to some dangerous tasks which can bring about vital issues. For example, being allowed to drive under the legal age may be prone for society.

On balance, it is true that giving freedom would seem disadvantageous under certain circumstances. However, in my view, its positive influences in terms of access to greater education and boosting their self-confidence outweigh the disadvantages.

title:
Some children spen hours every day on their smartphones. 

Why is this the case? Do you think this is a positive or a negative development?
content:
In today’s world, the use of smartphones is very common, particularly among the young generation. Spending many hours on mobile phones has become a daily routine for some children. In my view, this is concerning and can be deemed a negative development due to the lack of creativity and potential hindrance in brain development. This essay will explore the reasons behind this case.

Nowadays, smartphones play an important role in people's lives. They serve not only as tools of communication but also as channels for online exploration. The perspectives on using phones freely vary depending on families and situations. Some parents might give permission to their kids for study purposes only because they could use the internet to find unlimited knowledge regardless of going to school. Others may allow phone usage for entertainment, such as watching cartoons on Youtube, as they believe it helps with relaxation.

From my perspective, it is essential to recognize the potential drawbacks associated with uncontrolled phone usage. One significant issue is that when children spend more time on phones than going out to play with friends, they may lose social skills, which can lead to problems in their adulthood. Another adverse effect is that excessive phone use might cause health problems. Numerous studies suggest that prolonged screen time can directly impact concentration and memorization, especially in the younger generation who are increasingly reliant on smartphones.

In conclusion, excessive focus on screens every day can lead to adverse consequences for children. As a result, using smartphones for specific purposes should be allowed and monitored by parents to ensure their kids spend time online in an appropriate way.

title: some people believe that it is good to share as much information as possible in scientific research, business and the academic world. Others believe that some infomation is too important or too valueable to be shared freely.
content:
There are different opinions on whether to share free information related to scientific research, business and the academic world or consider such information too crucial for sharing. On the one hand, some people believe that information should be available to the masses. Sharing research results can improve the speed of innovations. Furthermore, spreading valuable information ought to broaden one’s horizons. The availability of information causes people’s awareness and increases their knowledge. On the other hand, individuals think that some data can lead to harmful repercussions for society. Spreading the information potentially may result in using it with bad intentions. Also, distributing specific information may violate the intellectual property of people or companies and can even lead to responsibility before the law. In conclusion, while people may vary in their opinions, I think that some information can be profitable and helpful for people. However, it also can be dangerous. So, information is influential and should be shared carefully with the public.

content:

In conclusion, managing and providing educational materials and facilities freely would be problematic due to its financial aspects for most regions and decreasing level of motivation among students.

title: People should look after their health as a duty to the society where they live, rather than for their own benefits. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
content:
It is true that some people think we should be responsible for taking care of our own health as a duty to society, whereas others consider that maintaining our fitness is just for our own good. Personally, I believe that both criteria should be given equal consideration. 

On the one hand, if we underestimate the importance of having good health, it might create a burden on the community. To be more specific, having an unhealthy body might lead to a variety of diseases, and people need to go to the hospital for treatment which sometimes occupies a lot of social resources, especially in countries that provide great social welfare. People might need to pay more tax due to the problems mentioned above. 

On the other hand, we can get several benefits by maintaining a healthy body. First of all, people who have good health do not need medication and they could save a lot of money. Secondly, with a healthy body, people could be more productive at work which is definitely an essential factor in one’s career. Last but not least, when we talk about well-being, it is not only physical but also mental. Lots of research has shown the importance of our mental health. People with great mental health could live a longer and more positive life. 

In conclusion, while taking good care of one’s health could regard as a duty to the society where we live, it could also help people to improve their life quality. So it’s a win-win situation to maintain a healthy body for all of us.

weight gain is also a problem that comes about from the excessive use of cars. title: It is often considered that change is more beneficial to people than trying to avoid it and have everything remain the same. Do you think the advantages of change outweigh the disadvantages?
content:
Many people believe that transition adds enormous value to their lives, but others refuse to change and prefer to stay the same. Although change may be unsettling for some, I consider the benefits of personal growth that generated by change exceed any disadvantages.

On the one hand, People resist change because their minds are used to certain circumstances. This means that people grow up with certain experiences and cultures. As a result, they form certain behaviours and beliefs. This makes it difficult for people to embrace change since it causes discomfort or undesired tension. For example, it is extremely difficult for an obese person to involve any change in their lifestyle. Moreover, even slight adjustments cause them give up and anxiety. However, I believe that a stronger support system can assist individuals to get over this issue and embrace the benefits of change.

On the other hand, The advantage of change is that it brings growth into life. Either can be personal growth or professional growth. It makes people happy when they see them improving in certain aspects of life. People push their discomfort to see new boundaries, which allows them to see life differently. As an illustration, I used to start an occupation that I had never done before. I was hesitant in the early stages, but eventually, I slowly adapted and accepted the role change. As a result, it brings to tremendous growth on a personal and professional level. Therefore, it is possible to draw a direct correlation between change and happiness.

In conclusion, people refuse growth because of the fear or anxiety they experience, but I once again restate that the benefits of embracing change outweigh the risks when we see how it adds to our happiness and fulfillment.

title: Everyone should stay at school until 18. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
content:
It is said that all students should stay at school until the age of eighteen. Although staying at school until adulthood can bring  enormous benefits, I still disagree with this idea for many reasons, which will be outlined in this essay.

   To begin with, children should continue to study at school until the age of eighteen does have several certain advantages. Firstly, there is a major group of young people, who is less than eighteen years old, have very little practical experience and have very little intention of what goals they will direct. Consequently, staying at school until mature age will help them have a suitable environment to develop their education and time to think about their future career path. Moreover, compelling candidates to stay at the institute until eighteen will create a better-educated future generation of people, which may assist to reduce social problems and unemployment rates.

    However, there is the figure of drawbacks that makes me disagree with this idea. It can be seen that many children these days do not fit in with the common education system and forcing them to remain at school can cause some problems. For example, these kinds of students are usually very disruptive in a classroom and this affects other students who are striving for study. Additionally, most students many children choose to follow careers that do not require them to continue studying in school past the age of sixteen. For instance, for those who wish to follow a career that requires more practical-based learning, such as a qualified builder, electrician, or machinery operator, it is quite unnecessary to remain at school until the age of eighteen.

    In conclusion, although there are many beneficial advantages for children remaining at school until adulthood. In my view, I personally feel that the drawbacks outweigh the positives mentioned above.

title: Some people believe that children’s leisure activities must be educational, otherwise they are a complete waste of time. Do you agree or disagree? Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your experience.
content:

Regarding my personal experiences, while often seen as a recreational activity, watching America TV shows (such as Friends) has brought unthinkable positive effects on me. Surprisingly, it was events without a purpose that benefited me.

In conclusion, educational events do not always reach their original goals, and possibly cased opposite outcomes. Additionally, entertainment can otherwise provide valuable educational achievements. Therefore, activities for teens should not be detailly planned, and certainly shall not always be educational.

title: In some countries elder people are to work longer and not to retire. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of working beyond retirement age.
content:
As more and more nations age, more and more elderly are encouraged to continue working over retirement age. In my opinion, there are possible benefits and drawbacks of extending individual working life.

On the positive side, working beyond retirement age can be beneficial in the following aspects. Firstly, continuing work improves the elderly's financial condition. More years in the job mean more experience, which in turn means more revenue. For skilled jobs, such as doctors, engineers and professors, people approaching retirement age tend to have rich experience and are also in the highest income period of their career. Furthermore, an elder person may find that having a job provides a sense of satisfaction. This is because people who have jobs have a sense of identity and feel they are part of society, which is necessary to maintain a good mental state. Not only that, but the active movement a job provides could help keep one’s body healthy. As physical exercise is important for everyone, especially for the elderly.

However, there are possible influences if people work after the average expected years. Obviously, it could damage their health condition. The older a human is, the more rest they need. When the elders do not get enough time to recover, it will pose a huge burden on  their bodies, leading to a series of physical problems, even death. Another disadvantage is that the interpersonal relationship can be affected. After investing so many years of one’s life into a career, they deserve a life of leisure and family happiness. If they are still occupied with a job, there will be less time to do what they love to do and enjoy with their family. In that case, some of them may develop a lonely lifestyle. 

In conclusion, there are benefits and risks to motivating old people to continue their careers. It could maintain health and acquire a sense of fulfilment, meanwhile, it could also result in more exhaustion and solitude. For those who continue to work beyond retirement age, it may be helpful to replace manual work with mental work as much as possible.

To sum up, while economic factors are the criteria that make successful countries, I believe that based on the citizen perspective social factors are more significant in terms of a progressive country.

title:

 disadvantages?

To begin with, the predominant advantage of the moving away of companies is definitely the development of the countryside. To further explain this, the relocation of major companies to the countryside is going to increase the labour force which would in turn help in economic growth leading to more education and employment opportunities, hence causing the rural areas to develop. Another major advantage of the relocation of businesses would be reduced pollution levels in major cities. With the reverse migration to rural areas, there would be a reduced number of automobiles leading to less carbon footprint and decreasing greenhouse effect. For instance, The major city in India, Delhi, is ranked as the most polluted city in the country, because of  overpopulation and huge traffic problems. Thus, the economic and environmental aspect of the relocation of businesses is highly advantageous.

While the aforementioned pros, there are several negative aspects to this that still need to be considered. One of the biggest drawbacks is the cost and time it would require to travel to work. People who live in the centre would now have to change their lifestyle and commute almost 30 to 40 kilometres every day to the job which would require not only plenty of time but also would cost a lot of money too, leading to elevated stress levels. For example, a research study done by  Harvard University showed that stress levels were more in an individual whose work was far away from home as compared to the one who loved nearby his job. 

To conclude, Although there are numerous benefits and drawbacks of moving businesses to the rural side at the same time,  the economic and  environmental benefits of the relocation of businesses are tremendous. Hence, the positive effects of  moving companies away definitely outweigh the negative ones.

content:
Numerous nations are becoming more affluent these days, whereas impoverished countries are getting worse. To tackle this, some suggest that it is vital to help low-income nations. I believe that the idea of supporting poorer nations is morally right and will reduce global challenges, including international migration. 

One leading cause why giving monetary aid to poorer nations is that it is morally right. Because rich countries can afford to support people in distressed regions, it could be ethically wrong not to help suffering nations who lack basics such as food, water and medicine. This is particularly important during difficult times when high inflation and food crises impact disproportionately poorer countries. 

Additionally, another primary reason why helping poorer nations is that it can contribute to the reduction of international migration. Factors such as lack of shelter, food and other essentials contribute to the increase of people escaping from their well-off countries to wealthier nations in search of a better life. Therefore, providing these nations with financial support in their homeland is crucial. 

However, it is also necessary that poorer nations take the initiative to improve their situations. In the long term, monetary assistance from Western countries is not sustainable because they will not be able to support other countries persistently in the long run. Authorities in poorer nations should, for instance, increase the quality of their institutions and create jobs and businesses. 

To conclude, helping poorer countries is vital for different reasons, including that it can give us a greater sense of humanity, and diminish global migration, as refugees are supported in their places. However, governments in impoverished countries should engage in finding solutions for their problems and strive to create opportunities for their citizens, incorporating employment opportunities for their nationals.

title: Many students find it difficult to concentrate or pay attention at school. What are the reasons? What could be done to solve this problem?
content:

Most of the students wake up very early for their busy schedules and feel sleepy in the first classes at school which makes it really hard to focus on any subject. Furthermore, there are generally many long and sequential course sessions, with boring and unattractive formats in general, with little breaks in between, which disables the students to recharge and energize herself/himself to get ready to learn new subjects. For instance, researchers published that teenagers' focus time is only 16 minutes, after that they got either distracted or bored. In that case, it does not make sense to hold up 40 mins sessions. In addition, technological devices such as tablets and smartphones are the top distractions, even one notification on the phone is enough to ruin the concentration of the students.

A possible solution can be a new arrangement of the time and content schedules at schools considering the new generations' challenges and advantages. Maybe arranging shorter sessions with more little breaks can help students to concentrate better. Besides, the formats of the contents might be more fun with gamification and usage of more attractive visuals and experiments if applicable. Another solution could be prohibiting smart devices throughout the learning time which blocks the possibility of being disturbed by them when focused.

In conclusion, the misarrangement of time and content format and smart devices can cause students to lose their focus, even though rearrangement of the school days and prohibiting smart devices can help the problem.

title: Nowadays, some employers think that formal academic qualifications are more important than life experience or personal qualities when they look for new employees. Why is it the case? To what extent do you agree or disagree?
content:
There is a controversial statement heating up a debate over the fact that some recruiters favour candidates who have formal credentials for study over those with only life experience or good personality traits in today's society. This essay will look at some causes of this and I personally do not have a consensus with this idea.

Without a shadow of a doubt, academic degrees are valued more than life experience and character by some employers when they seek new staff. Because they believe that potential employees with an excellent qualification are equipped with in-depth knowledge and useful skills which play a crucial part in their future careers. For instance, some leading technology firms, namely FPT, Vingroup and so on, highly appreciate prospective workers who have Information Technology degrees or Internet Engineering certificates, therefore an improved quality of life for candidates who take them. Hence, taking academic background as a priority in recruit procedures exerts certain virtues.

In conclusion, although academic qualifications can have certain values, it should not be regarded as the only and the most important factor to select the best workers.

title:

content:

title:
Some people get into debt by buying things they don’t need and can’t afford.

What are the reasons for this behaviour?

What action can be taken to prevent people from having this problem?
content:
Nowadays, some individuals have financial problems because they overuse their money by consuming goods that are useless for them. This essay will discuss the reasons behind this phenomenon and provide practical solutions to address the issue.

People purchase consumptions that they do not need and get into debt because they lack basic knowledge of personal asset management. That is because the education system we have in the contemporary era only focuses on theoretical knowledge without providing basic tools for students to live their daily lives, leading to a sufficient sense of investment and saving after they grow up. Therefore, people tend to use every quarter in their pocket for consumption without considering their financial situations, and this can harm them in the long term as they need to work twice hard to pay back their debts and have no time for further developments in both personal and professional settings. For example, according to a survey about college graduates in China, the major problem of their school curriculums is the lack of basic finance and investment courses, which may prevent them from over-consumption after they graduate.

To solve the problem, the general public, financial institutions and governments should act together in an endeavour. On an individual level, people can use the Internet to self-study related knowledge about asset management and proper consumption behaviours. In addition, banks and other financial authorities should publish more strict regulations to loan money to people for consumption, which can prevent people from over-consumption in the early stage. Finally, governments should restrict education systems by adding financial courses into curricula, teaching students from primary school, and developing their purchase hygiene gradually. For instance, the Japanese government forced all the elementary schools to set up a pocket money course in which students can learn about the different ways to use their money and the according results, which was highly commented by citizens.

In conclusion, some people struggle with their consumption debts for useless things because they have insufficient knowledge about asset management and have no plan for their consumption in advance. All the individuals by learning financial knowledge, banks by setting strictly examining progress of loan, and governments by adjusting curriculums and adding consumption practices for students can help to address the issue.

title: Many students find it difficult to concentrate or pay attention at school. What are the reasons? What could be done to solve this problem?
content:
Many learners struggle to focus in different learning institutions. The reasons for this are that the human brain has a limited time limit for concentrating, and students have many distractions at school, such as friends and sports. These challenges can be resolved by creating many breaks during learning and making the learning process interesting or fun. It is also prudent to set aside time for school work or study to curb the effects of distractions. This essay will discuss these matters at length. 

First and foremost, it is difficult for many students to concentrate at school because the human brain can only concentrate for a short period, the reason why many lessons are scheduled with several breaks. Likewise, there are so many distractions at school such as friends and sporting activities; these divert attention away from learning. For example, it has been found by studies in several schools in the USA, that when students make friends, they stop paying attention to their studies and become interested in games and leisure activities with their mates. 

To resolve these issues, first, parents and teachers should assist the learners to create and follow set timetables for individual study. At such times, they must give all their attention to learning rather than playing. Secondly, learning institutions need to create many breaks for students so that their brains can regain composure and strength; learning must also be made more fun, as in the case of many learn-through-play activities which allow for more relaxation and concentration. For instance, in the same studies conducted in the USA, it was found that teachers resorted to using games and other interactive learning methods to promote concentration. These improved the pass rates in the schools surveyed. 

In conclusion, therefore, focusing at school is a problem for learners because of the distractions they encounter, such as their friends, but also because their brains can only assimilate small amounts of information at a time. The solutions to these issues are to make learning fun and to create as many breaks as possible to re-energise the brain. These are the issues the essay has discussed.

title:
Some people argue that all experimentation on animals is bad and should be outlawed. However, others believe that important scientific discoveries can be made from animal experiments.

Can experimentation on animals be justified? Are there any alternatives?
content:
In the past, animal experiments are totally acceptable and necessary. Nowadays, due to technological improvements, this type of experimentation could reduce. This essay will argue about these experiences and the alternatives that already exist. 

In the early twenty century, animals were vital for experiments in order to obtain knowledge and learn about the body system's works. Because of them, in all these years, everybody can take medicine and use cosmetic products safely. For instance, in the past, animal test had not used in a specific type of medicine for pregnancy, and the result was the members deformation of many babies, as well as an eyelash cosmetic that was also not tested on animals which ended up to made blind people who used it. Currently, advancing technology is paramount to reducing these tests, and more comprehension of the cruelty methodology used is essential to change the methods to avoid animal suffering. In summary, this essay approached the evolution of animal tests' necessity in the past and how they could be replaced throughout the years by the advance of technology.

title: If we want to solve global problems, countries must learn to collaborate more and compete less. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
content:
The problems governments face nowadays are often shared by other countries. Many regions of the world suffer from extreme weather, internet crime and large population movements. Is it better to deal with these problems through collaboration or competition? I believe that competition is more effective.

Firstly, collaboration can be a very slow process. Although communication technology has improved greatly, countries that choose to collaborate still must work together across great distances using different languages. Relationships between leaders may develop slowly or even deteriorate as they negotiate across linguistic and cultural divisions. Political leaders may therefore lose trust in each other.

The second reason for my view is that attempts to collaborate are often unsuccessful. Countries with different aims and values often find it hard to work together, and the need to compromise often means that solutions become less effective. International agreements on climate change, for example, tend to lack ambition. Any failure to agree may even damage relationships between states. But if countries act individually, they can act more quickly and other countries might then gain from their experience.

 Lastly, I think that people tend to work harder when they compete. In the same way that businesses innovate in response to competition, competing countries may look for innovative solutions as they try to win respect from the international community. In fact, as a result of competition, several quite different solutions may be developed, and the world may benefit from a greater range of options.

In conclusion, collaboration represents a less effective process for solving problems than competition. There will always be some need to collaborate, for example, when resolving conflict. But if we want to solve problems, it’s essential that we take advantage of friendly competition.

title: Nowadays, a growing number of people with health problems are trying alternative medicines and treatments instead of visiting their usual doctor. Do you thing this is a positive or a negative development?
content:
More and more individuals are turning to alternative medicines and treatments instead of seeking traditional medical advice. In my view, this trend is concerning and can be deemed as a negative development due to the potential risks involved, such as inappropriate cures and financial exploitation.

One significant drawback of opting for unconventional treatments is the risk of exacerbating health issues. People may seek alternative options due to various reasons, such as financial constraints, prior unsuccessful treatments, or living in remote areas. However, if they receive treatment from individuals lacking proper medical knowledge, it can be hazardous to their well-being. Relying on medicines from unreliable sources or the internet may adversely affect the patient's symptoms, leading to a deterioration of their health condition.

Furthermore, this growing inclination towards alternative treatments presents an opportunity for scammers to take advantage of vulnerable patients. Desperate for relief from their ailments, some patients might fall prey to fraudulent individuals offering expensive yet baseless guarantees of a cure. Those who have lost hope in traditional medicine become susceptible to these scams, unknowingly subjecting themselves to financial exploitation.

In conclusion, while the popularity of alternative treatments may be on the rise, it is essential to recognize the potential drawbacks associated with such practices. Opting for treatments without proper medical guidance can lead to adverse consequences for patients, jeopardizing their health and finances. Therefore, it is imperative for individuals to exercise caution and seek advice from qualified medical professionals to ensure the best possible care and outcomes for their well-being.

title: Car ownership has increased so rapidly over the past thirty years that in many cities around the world, there are constant traffic jams. How true do you think this statement is? What measures can governments take to discourage people from owning cars?
content:
The entire world is fascinated by technical breakthroughs in this fast-advancing scientific era. Over the past three decades, car ownership has increased significantly and at a never-before-seen rate. Traffic is now extremely congested as a result of this. In my opinion, governments may undoubtedly start some suggested efforts to control this threat.

Setting the stage for the discussion, the purchase and use of private cars have evolved significantly during the past few decades. The flexibility of commuting is probably the most significant of the many reasons why many people prefer to possess their own automobiles. Many people also express great enthusiasm for the new vehicles that have been introduced to the market since they have advanced features, innovation, security features, and luxury. As a result, there are more vehicles on the road than the roads and passengers can handle, which leads to traffic congestion. Furthermore, many governments in developing nations take the least care to construct additional roads and appropriate parking spaces, and their actions further exacerbate the traffic issues.

Supporting my viewpoint further, governments can impose strict rules to cut down on car ownership and manage traffic jams. In order to decrease the chaos caused by traffic jams, the government should prioritize developing enough parking lots, new highways, and flyovers. It should also actively promote encouraging individuals to walk and ride bikes wherever possible. Additionally, the government has to persuade commuters to ditch their automobiles in favour of less expensive public transit options like buses and metro trains. Finally, and most crucially, the government must raise auto ownership taxes while also enhancing public transportation options to deter as many people as possible from buying cars.

To summarize, strong steps should be taken by the appropriate authorities to limit the number of cars on the road in order to reduce traffic congestion and pollution. congestion. In addition, individuals should be educated on the advantages of biking and walking as modes of transportation.

title: There is an increasing trend around the world of married couples deciding not to have children, Discuss the advantages and disadvantages for couple who decide to do this.

title:
Some people prefer living in a house while others feel that there are more advantages to living in an apartment.

Are there more advantages than disadvantages of living in an apartment?
content:
Some individuals have a preference for houses, whereas others think it is more beneficial to reside in flats. I believe living in houses offers numerous advantages, such as increased living space and a greater sense of private life when compared to residing in apartments. 

There are more benefits to dwelling in houses. Firstly, they are often more spacious and family-friendly than flats. This is important for many people, in particular, larger families who need spacious rooms in which they can live together with comfort. Secondly, houses are usually built with considerable spaces between them.  That is to say, those who live in houses might keep their lives secret. In contrast, apartments are close and in the same building block, meaning that your neighbours can easily hear what is happening in your accommodation. For instance, my brother, who is a doctor and has his own house in Kent in the UK, enjoys living in a quiet house that is not close to other accommodations.

Despite these advantages, living in houses has its drawbacks. One disadvantage is that it is challenging to maintain hygienic standards. This is because such buildings cover a large area which requires more cleaning. In fact, people who live in houses not only do they need to clean inside their spacious dwellings but also their gardens; both the front and the back yards are to be taken into consideration. Another drawback is that the prices of houses are considerably higher than apartments. As a consequence, low- and middle-class families cannot afford to buy them. 

In conclusion, residing in houses provides various benefits, including creating a family-oriented environment and enjoying a sense of privacy. However, the need for extra house cleaning can deter certain individuals from buying. Moreover, not all people can buy them because of the enormous price required.

title: These days the fashions in clothing are constantly changing. Is this affecting individuals and the environment in a positive or a negative way? Give reasons for your answer and include relevant examples from your knowledge and experience.
content:
In the ever-changing world, alteration in the fashion industry is no exception. However, such continuous change can negatively impact the people and the surroundings by increasing their unnecessary expenditure and excessive resource consumption respectively.

Individuals mostly prefer to be in trend with fashion in order to imitate celebrities. This habit not only can lead to extravagant spending but can also develop the habit of showing off which can bleakly affect during the lows of one’s life. In addition, people begin forgetting their inner personality and start believing that up-market clothes can foster their self-confidence. To exemplify, under peer pressure, teenagers are highly cautious about their dresses and often try to wear the latest designs to attract attention. Hence, the above reason and example vividly illustrate the effect on individuals.

The constant production of wearables requires a great amount of resources. Although high demand in the market is good for the  economy, the increased requirement surge the demand for raw materials which affects the ecosystem in multiple aspects. Firstly, tons of water are needed to grow cotton which is the most prominent ingredient for the production. Secondly, in order to fulfil the requirement, acres of fields are essential which can ultimately decrease the portion of eatable crops. Finally, the cotton crop reduces the fertility of the region which makes it unusable for agriculture for a longer duration. As per the report issued by Agricultural Ministry, Calcutta has the largest barren land because of the high amount of cotton production. Thus, the aforementioned reasons substantiate how fashion badly affects the environment.

To conclude, the increased urge to purchase fashionable attires not only affects human beings by causing financial burden but also negatively influences the ecosystem by using immense water, diminishing food crops and degrading the health of the land.

title: In many countries, art galleries visitors have been declining steadily. What are the possible reason? how to change this trend?

title: In some countries, owning a home rather than renting one is very important for people. Why might this be the case? Do you think this a positive or negative situation?

title: Shops should not be allowed to sell any food or drink that has been scientifically proven to be bad for people's health. To what extent do you agree or disagree?

title: ‘Everybody should donate a fixed amount of their income to support charity.’ How far do you share this viewpoint?
content:
It is said that a certain portion of the salary that people receive must be contributed to foundations. It seems to me that philanthropy should not be forced on everybody, and I will explain why in this essay. 

Firstly, everybody has different financial circumstances as well as priorities, which restricts their budget to their own needs and desires. title:
If a product is good or it meets people's needs, people will buy it so advertising is unnecessary.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?
content:
There is a prevalent argument suggesting that advertising becomes unnecessary when merchandise possesses commendable conditions or effectively meets the demands of consumers. From my perspective, I strongly dissent from this perspective as it also facilitates the acquisition of new customers, enhances the level of competition, and disseminates information to society regarding the company's social initiatives.

One compelling justification for my perspective is that advertising plays a pivotal role in enabling companies to expand their market share. Advertisements play a crucial role in enhancing the visibility and perception of products or services, thereby increasing consumer awareness. It is important to note that the high quality of a product does not automatically result in widespread consumer awareness throughout the entire market. For example, a bakery specializing in the sale of delectable banh mi sandwiches may primarily enjoy a reputation among its local clientele. However, through the utilization of social network advertising, it has the potential to draw the attention of discerning food enthusiasts from various parts of the city.

One additional rationale for my dissent is that advertising significantly contributes to market competition. This phenomenon can be attributed to the inherent tendency of individuals to consistently pursue superior options for consumption. Due to this rationale, comprehensive advertising campaigns possess the ability to educate consumers about the offerings of a particular business and allure them towards transitioning their brand preferences. An additional explanation for my dissent lies in the utilization of advertising as a means to disseminate the social endeavours undertaken by corporations. In order to contribute to the betterment of society, individuals are encouraged to engage in the purchase of goods and services from companies that are recognized for their commitment to social responsibility. Vinmart, a prominent agency, experienced a notable increase in customer footfall in the subsequent months following a marketing campaign that publicized its initiative to offer red meals to underprivileged individuals amidst the COVID-19 pandemic.

In summary, there is a prevalent belief that advertising is superfluous when the quality of a product is deemed satisfactory. I vehemently disagree with this proposition due to the fact that advertising fulfils important objectives such as augmenting market share, facilitating competition with rival brands, and bolstering sales by informing the public about the enterprise's social initiatives. I would like to propose that companies consistently incorporate advertising initiatives into their commercial pursuits, irrespective of the exceptional quality of their products.

title: 26.In some countries the average weight of people is increasing and their levels of health and fitness are decreasing. What do you think are the causes of these problems and what measures could be taken to solve them?

title: 24.Nowadays, a growing number of people with health problems are trying alternative medicines and treatments instead of visiting their usual doctor. title:

In conclusion, following a local style can have an impact on locals but also poses health risks. Promoting one's own culture may increase the interest of tourists and the country. I am a firm believer that tourists should obey the rules of the country they are visiting.

title: 17.Some people believe that there should be fixed punishments for each type of crime. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
content:
The allocation of punishment for criminals has been a highly debated topic. Many intellectuals are in favour of fixed sentences for different crimes, while others believe that judicial systems should take into account all the elements of a crime and sentence accordingly. This article presents both perspectives and elaborates on mine.

Firstly, the previous perspective places significant importance on pre-determined sentences for different criminal offences. This optimistic view is leading to a lack of diversity in punishments. As a result, the time-consuming judicial system will become more efficient, and the crime rate will be suppressed to a great extent. For example, fixed penalties can help create a fair work environment, which would boost public trust in the law. Therefore, by implementing a common policy for all criminals, the crime rate will decrease.

On the other hand, the latter view paints a picture of the flexibility of the legislative system for various crimes. This view focuses more on the seriousness of the crime, and therefore, the criminal should be punished. In addition, the circumstances and motives of the crime scene are also considered in the judgment. Although this type of jurisdiction is time-consuming, it can save innocent people. For example, a murder and an intentional assassination committed by a person in self-defence require different perspectives and punishments. Therefore, dynamic laws can effectively mitigate potential crimes.

In summary, the sentence regarding criminal activity has a significant impact on criminal behaviour. In my opinion, the dynamic characteristics of the jurisdiction are more favourable for society to effectively curb criminal activity.

title: Some people think that intelligent student should teach separately whereas others think that everyone should teach together. Discuss both views and give your opinion
content:
In this day and age, education has been improving exceedingly, offering more and more opportunities for students to unlock. However, there are claims suggesting that there should be distinct classes where gifted students can study on their own whereas others argue that all learners should learn in the same classroom. This essay will discuss both views as well as give out my own perspective. 

On one hand, it is true that when talented pupils get to have their own teachers and mentors, they can grow and flourish their skills more easily as they are learning on their own level while other students are learning on theirs. For instance, pupils who are more advanced in Math will be able to learn more complex equations in the gifted classrooms and develop their gift instead of studying at a much easier level that doesn’t help with their skill. Moreover, it would be much easier for educators to assist students who are in need of help and support instead of just concentrating on or ignoring the brilliant learners. 

On the other hand, doing this may result in separation and labels around school, making talented kids in better classes more superior and may result in bullying and a lack of morals in students. In Addition, these levels and classes may not be accurate to a learner’s actual performance, as there are certain teenagers who are content with their current class and would not like to put effort to excel. 

In conclusion, despite the said positives of this issue, there are a lot of downsides that should be taken into consideration. In my point of view, it is vastly more advantageous to teach everyone in an equal manner and not divide them into different classes as it would help the child have more competition and gain more opportunities to grow.
